We'd be very excited to integrate this code!

Does it require changes to core classes, or is it largely self-contained 
in its own new classes? (Especially with regard to the Frontier -- 
because any changes there would require a little more work to bring to 
the 2.x trunk.)

We would probably plan another release as 1.14.x (or even 
previously-unplanned 1.16.0) to have an official 1.x release with such a 
interesting contribution, even before trying to bring such code into 2.x.

- Gordon @ IA

Goel, Ankur wrote:
> Hi Folks,
>             We have our own implementation of the crawl farm based on
> top of Heritrix 1.6. We moved to version 1.13 sometime back.
> As a part of our work we have extended the heritrix code and implemented
> a consistent hashing scheme for maintaining politeness
> and consistent distribution. We would like to contribute some of our
> distribution related code to the heritrix community.
>  
> Let me give a brief idea of what we have done that we would like to
> contribute. 
>  
> 1. Each crawl node (called crawl engine in heritrix 2.0)  is responsible
> for figuring out if it should crawl the recieved/extracted URLs 
> or the right crawler node that should be crawling it and dispatches the
> URLs over JMX to the appropriate node. 
>  
> 2. The crawl node uses the services of a 'DynamicCrawlMapper' to take
> care of distribution. This is a regular heritrix 'Processor' integrated
> into heritrix processing chain.
>  
> 3. The 'DynamicCrawlMapper' uses the services of a 'Distributor' that
> talks to different crawl nodes over JMX and uses consistent hashing 
> scheme to figure the destination node for the URL. If the URL's hash
> falls in the bucket of the local node then it is scheduled directly
> into the local heritrix instance.
>  
> 4. The 'Distributor' caches the info for all other crawl nodes. So in
> this environment every crawl node is agnostic of every other crawl node.
>  
> If the community thinks this could bring value then we can work towards
> scrubbing out our custom code and get all licensing/legal issues 
> sorted out to get the code into heritrix.
>  
> Thanks
> -Ankur
>
